advanced_audio_settings_h.help1Txt1: Configure the advanced audio settings for the
advanced_audio_settings_h.help2Txt: Enable speech filter - This band pass filter reduces noise by filtering out all frequencies below 100 Hz and all above 3500 Hz. The filter cuts the lowest and the highest frequencies.
advanced_audio_settings_h.help3Txt: Enable echo cancellation - If audio from the speaker is captured by the microphone, this will produce an echo. Enable this option to reduce acoustic echoing.
advanced_audio_settings_h.okiChip: Noise canceller attenuation - Noise cancelling is a way of reducing the background noise when a microphone, for example, is set up in a noisy environment and you are only interested in hearing a person who is talking close to it. The noise canceller attenuation produces maximum noise reduction when set to 18 dB of attenuation. If the Noise canceller attenuation is set to 0 dB, no noise cancellation is performed. Optimize the sound quality by listening to the sound and adjusting the attenuation level as required.
advanced_audio_settings_h.help4Txt:
Noise canceller threshold value and Noise canceller attenuation - Noise cancelling is a way of reducing the background noise when there is no useful audio. A typical application is that the camera is set up in a noisy environment, and you are only interested in hearing sound e.g. when a person is talking close to the microphone.

There are two parameters available to optimize this function:
  • Noise canceller threshold value
  • Noise canceller attenuation
When the incoming sound is louder than the threshold, it will pass without any changes. When the incoming sound is weaker than the threshold, it will be reduced by a certain attenuation factor (measured in dB).

The threshold value should be set higher than the background noise, but lower than the useful audio. A lower threshold will accept most of the audio, only the weakest background noise will be reduced. A higher threshold will make the noise canceller act on even stronger background noise.

The noise canceller attenuation produces maximum noise reduction when set to 17 dB of attenuation. If the Noise canceller attenuation is set to 0 dB, no noise cancellation is performed.

Notes:
  • Setting the maximum noise canceller threshold value to High may reduce the amount of useful audio.

  • There is a trade-off between noise cancelling and sound quality. Increasing the noise attenuation causes sound quality to deteriorate, and decreasing it causes sound quality to improve.

Optimize the threshold and the attenuation by listening to the sound quality and adjusting the levels as required.
advanced_audio_settings_h.help5Txt: Click Save to save the settings, or click Reset to reset to factory default values.

audio_settings_h.introTxt2: Configure the audio settings for this device.
audio_settings_h.enable_one_sourceTxt: Check this box to enable audio functionality.
audio_settings_h.enable_multiple_sourcesTxt: Check the required boxes to enable audio functionality on the individual video sources.
audio_settings_h.modeTxt1: Audio mode - This sets the type of audio transmission. The available options are:
audio_settings_h.modeTxt2:
Full duplex - Simultaneous two-way audio. Transmit and receive audio (talk and listen) at the same time.

Note: There is no echo cancellation; if feedback loops occur, try moving the microphone or the speaker.
audio_settings_h.modeTxt3: Half-duplex - Half-duplex mode sends and receives audio in one direction at a time. A Talk/Listen button is used to switch between sending and receiving audio. For more information about the Talk/Listen button go to Live View.
audio_settings_h.modeTxt4b: speaker only - In simplex mode, audio is sent in one direction only. In this case, audio is sent by the operator to the speaker connected to the
audio_settings_h.modeTxt4c: . This could be used, to provide spoken instructions to a person seen on the camera. This mode requires you to use the Talk button. For more information about the Talk button go to Live View.
audio_settings_h.modeTxt5b: microphone only - A simplex mode that transmits audio from the
audio_settings_h.modeTxt5c: to one or more clients. This can be used in remote monitoring.
audio_settings_h.clientTxt: Send the sound from the active client to all other clients - The audio feed from one client will be broadcast to all other connected clients. Note that this option can only be enabled when using Half-duplex mode.
audio_settings_h.input_portTxt: Port - Select Audio 1 or Audio 2 from the drop-down list. Audio 1 can be used for an electret microphone or an unbalanced dynamic microphone. Audio 2 is for a balanced microphone. Audio 1 cannot be combined with equipment connected to Audio 2. See the product's user's manual for more information on connecting microphones.
audio_settings_h.input_PinTxt: Source - Select Microphone for an internal microphone or Line for a Line in device, e.g. an audio mixer for multiple microphones or a microphone with a built-in amplifier. If no external microphone is connected the internal microphone will be used.
audio_settings_h.input_micTxt: Source - Select Internal microphone if audio is to be transmitted from the microphone built into the camera, or External microphone to use a separate microphone connected to the audio input. Line is to be selected when connecting a Line in device, e.g. an audio mixer for multiple microphones or a microphone with a built-in amplifier.
audio_settings_h.input_micLineTxt: Source - Select Internal microphone if audio is to be transmitted from the microphone built into the camera, or External microphone to use a separate microphone connected to the audio input.
audio_settings_h.input_VSTxt: Source - Select Microphone for an external microphone or Line for a Line in device e.g. an audio mixer for multiple microphones or a microphone with a built-in amplifier.
audio_settings_h.input_VS_1Txt: Source - Select Microphone for an internal microphone or select Line for a Line in device e.g. an audio mixer for multiple microphones or a microphone with a built-in amplifier. Note that, if no external microphone is connected, the internal microphone will be used.
audio_settings_h.all_SourcesTxt: Source - Select Internal microphone if audio is to be transmitted from the microphone built into the Axis product, or External microphone to use a separate microphone connected to the audio input. Line is to be selected when connecting a Line in device, for example, an audio mixer for multiple microphones or a microphone with a built-in amplifier.
audio_settings_h.input_builtinmicTxt: Source - Microphone, audio will be transmitted from the microphone built into the camera.
audio_settings_h.srcTxt: Source - Lists the internal microphone in this product.
audio_settings_h.balTxt: Balanced - Select the Yes radio button if the microphone is balanced.
audio_settings_h.micBoostTxt: +30 dB microphone boost - Check this box to amplify the signal of the external microphone connected to the Axis product. Microphone boost option is useful when a microphone's volume is too low and you want to increase it.
audio_settings_h.micBoostTxt-1: +30 dB microphone boost - Check this box to amplify the signal of the external microphone connected to the Axis product. Microphone boost option is useful when a microphone's volume is too low and you want to increase it. This option is not available when the Line source is selected.
audio_settings_h.sens_internal_only_camTxt1: Microphone - Input sensitivity - Set the sensitivity level of the microphone depending on the sound level in the monitored area, e.g. set to Low if the
audio_settings_h.sens_internal_only_camTxt2: is installed in a noisy environment.
audio_settings_h.sens_camTxt1:
Input sensitivity - set the sensitivity level of the audio input according to the following:

If Internal microphone is selected (see Source above) - set the Input sensitivity to High or Low, depending on the sound level in the monitored area, e.g. Low if the
audio_settings_h.sens_camTxt2:
is installed in a noisy environment.

If External microphone is selected - set the Input sensitivity to:
  • High if the connected microphone is an ordinary (unamplified) microphone, e.g. a computer microphone or clip-on microphone.
  • Low if the connected microphone has a built-in line amplifier.
audio_settings_h.sens_VSTxt:
Input sensitivity - When Microphone is selected for Source (see above), set this to:
  • High for an ordinary (unamplified) microphone, e.g. a computer microphone or clip-on microphone.
  • Low for a microphone with a built-in line amplifier.
audio_settings_h.micPwrTxt: Microphone power - Look at the user documentation for your microphone and select the appropriate voltage or phantom voltage from the drop-down list.
audio_settings_h.micPwrTxt-1: Microphone power - The microphone power option provides DC power for an external microphone. Microphone power should only be used with microphones that have no battery and should not be enabled when using a dynamic or battery powered microphone. Look at the user documentation for your microphone and select the appropriate voltage or phantom voltage from the drop-down list.
audio_settings_h.dC1Txt: Microphone power - Microphone power should only be used with electric microphones that have no battery. This setting should not be enabled when using a dynamic or battery powered microphone.
audio_settings_h.dC2Txt: Enable microphone power - Microphone power should only be used with electric microphones that have no battery and when using the internal microphone. This setting should not be enabled when using a dynamic or battery powered microphone.
audio_settings_h.mic48vTxt: Enable 48V microphone phantom power - Provides 48 V DC phantom power to a microphone connected to Audio 2.
audio_settings_h.lEDTxt: Enable microphone level LED - The microphone level LED is used to indicate the strength of the sound captured by the microphone. See the User's Manual for more information.
audio_settings_h.gainTITxt: Input gain - Volume control of the audio input represented in dB value. Use the Level bar for a visual representation of the audio signal strength. If the sound is too low choose a higher value. If the sound is too high choose a lower value.
audio_settings_h.levelTxt:
Level - The Level bar is a visual representation of the audio signal in dB.
  • Green - The signal is at a good level.
  • Yellow - The signal is becoming distorted.
  • Red - The signal is distorted.
Use the Input gain drop-down list to adjust the volume.
audio_settings_h.gain_commentTxt:
The Input sensitivity levels High and Low are volume settings made earlier in the audio path (see above).

Note: Low Input sensitivity should never be compensated by a high Input gain, as this may cause unwanted noise.
audio_settings_h.encodingTxt1: Encoding - Select the digital audio encoding format to use.
audio_settings_h.encodingTxt2: G711 - is an unlicensed standard codec that is useful when integrating audio into a VoIP system.
audio_settings_h.encodingTxt3: G726 - is an unlicensed speech codec that is most commonly used within the security industry.
audio_settings_h.encodingTxt4a: AAC - requires a license for both encoding and decoding. AAC is the least complicated and most widely used codec. If achieving the best possible audio quality is a priority, AAC is the recommended codec to use. AAC license is included in the
audio_settings_h.samplerateTxt: Sample rate - The number of times per second the sound is sampled. A higher sample rate will provide better audio quality, but also requires a greater bandwidth.
audio_settings_h.bitrateTxt: Bit rate - Depending on the selected encoding, set the required bit rate. A higher bit rate will give better audio quality. A lower bit rate may have latency or delay, but will require less bandwidth.
audio_settings_h.outputNoheadphoneTxt: Output gain - Volume control of the line audio output in dB. The output can be connected to an amplifier with speakers.
audio_settings_h.outputTxt: Output gain - Volume control of the line audio output in dB. The output can be used with high impedance headphones or connected to another amplifier with speakers.
audio_settings_h.speakAmpTxt:
Enable speaker amplifier -To use the built-in amplifier for speakers connected to Audio 2, check this box.

Note: If speakers are connected to both Audio 1 and Audio 2, Audio 1 is used.

audio_support_h.help2Txt1: Enable audio support - Allow clients to retrieve audio streams from the
audio_support_h.help2Txt2:
.

If disabled there will be no support for audio in the product. For example, no audio will be available even if audio in the video stream is enabled.
